io.fluo.api.data

Class Bytes

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.fluo.api.data.Bytes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Bytes>

    public abstract class Bytes
extends Object
implements Comparable<Bytes>
    Represents bytes in Fluo. Similar to an Accumulo ByteSequence

      • offset

        public abstract int offset()
        Gets the offset for this byte sequence. This value represents the starting point for the sequence in the backing array, if there is one.
        Returns:
        offset (inclusive)

      • compareBytes

        public static int compareBytes(Bytes b1,
               Bytes b2)
        Compares the two given byte sequences, byte by byte, returning a negative, zero, or positive result if the first sequence is less than, equal to, or greater than the second. The comparison is performed starting with the first byte of each sequence, and proceeds until a pair of bytes differs, or one sequence runs out of byte (is shorter). A shorter sequence is considered less than a longer one.
        Parameters:
        b1 - first byte sequence to compare
        b2 - second byte sequence to compare
        Returns:
        comparison result

      • compareTo

      • wrap

        public static Bytes wrap(byte[] data,
         int offset,
         int length)
        Creates a Bytes object by wrapping a subsequence of the given byte array. The given byte array is used directly as the backing array, so later changes made to the (relevant portion of the) array reflect into the new Byte array.
        Parameters:
        data - Byte data
        offset - Starting offset in byte array (inclusive)
        length - Number of bytes to include
